title: Adaptive Contextual Perception: How to Generalize to New Backgrounds and Ambiguous Objects. (arXiv:2306.05963v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Biological vision systems make adaptive use of context to recognize objects in new settings with novel contexts as well as occluded or blurry objects in familiar settings. In this paper, we investigate how vision models adaptively use context for out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization and leverage our analysis results to improve model OOD generalization. First, we formulate two distinct OOD settings where the contexts are either irrelevant (Background-Invariance) or beneficial (Object-Disambiguation), reflecting the diverse contextual challenges faced in biological vision. We then analyze model performance in these two different OOD settings and demonstrate that models that excel in one setting tend to struggle in the other. Notably, prior works on learning causal features improve on one setting but hurt in the other. tldr: 本文研究了自适应情境感知对分布外泛化的重要性，提出了一种基于人类视觉感知流程的新框架（LCP）来改善现有模型在处理多种情境挑战时的表现，并揭示了现有模型在利用情境时存在的各种偏见。
